posts.text: 🇳🇱 Despite his win in the November elections, Dutch far-right politician Geert #Wilders announced via X that he will not be prime minister, saying he didn't haver the support of a strong enough political coalition.

🇮🇱 One of the few remaining food centre in the #Gaza Strip was hit by an Israeli strike according to the Israeli army, killing 5, including a staff member from the #UNRWA, the #UN Agency for #Palestinian Refugees.

Camille Knight has the story ⤵️

The ship Opens Arms left Cyprus for the Gaza coast on October 12 with 200 tonnes of food supplies, the first ship to sail as part of a maritime aid corridor initiated by Cyprus, with the support of the European Union, the UK and the US. Given the humanitarian crisis in Gaza, the charities leading the effort felt they couldn’t wait for the US military to complete a pier to deliver aid.

🇮🇱 These protesters want to restore Israeli settlements in #Gaza, 19 years after Israel's 2005 disengagement from the zone, when the government dismantled 21 settlements that had been home to some 8,000 Israelis.

A powerful Haitian gang leader pledged Wednesday to continue the fighting that has plunged the country into chaos, as stakeholders work toward establishing a transitional governing body to replace the outgoing prime minister.

The main UN aid agency in war-ravaged Gaza said an Israeli strike Wednesday hit one of its warehouses, killing an employee. Meanwhile Israel plans to tell 1.4 million displaced Palestinians in the southern city of Rafah to move to central Gaza ahead of a planned offensive. Follow FRANCE 24's liveblog for all the latest developments in the Israel-Gaza war.
Atletico Madrid bounced back from two goals down on aggregate against Inter Milan to reach the Champions League quarter-finals with a thrilling 3-2 penalty shoot-out triumph on Wednesday.

The widow of Russia’s late opposition leader Alexei Navalny is calling on voters in the country’s presidential election to turn up at polling stations en masse at 12 noon on March 17 and either vote against Vladimir Putin or spoil their ballot. The protest action, known as “Noon Against Putin”, aims to honour Navalny’s last wishes, while illustrating the high number of voters who are against Russia’s war on Ukraine.

🇷🇺 People online have been widely circulating footage that they say shows the #Russians transporting nuclear weapons, which some claim is in response to Sweden joining NATO 

Via The Observers - France 24

🎤 After it was rumoured that singer Aya #Nakamura was to sing an Edith Piaf song at the #Olympics opening ceremony, she received 'racist' backlash from the far-right. 

🇫🇷 #France's Culture Minister Rachida #Dati took a stance and defended her
The eldest child of #French #WorldWarII Resistance leader and first postwar president Charles de Gaulle, has died aged 102

🇪🇺🤖 The European Parliament has given its final approval to wide-ranging rules to govern #ArtificialIntelligence.

That means the #EU is moving closer to adopting the world’s first #AI rules

🤳 🇺🇸 The #US House of Representatives overwhelmingly approved a bill that forces Chinese tech giant #ByteDance to divest the app, or be banned from the United States. The bill now heads to the more cautious Senate  👇

✈️  #Boeing is in turmoil after a string of incidents, the latest being a flight dropping mid-air and injuring dozens of travellers. 

In a turn of events, a whistleblower and former employee was found dead Saturday from apparent self-inflicted wounds.

🇫🇷 🎓The elite French university #SciencesPo is in turmoil after pro-Palestinian demonstrators allegedly barred a Jewish student from entering campus on Tuesday. Today, the director, who was accused of domestic violence back in December, resigned.

🇪🇬 In #Egypt, families hoping to break fast during the holy month of #Ramadan have to face record-high #inflation and rising food prices.

To fight this, the government is running a special low-price food market.

🇷🇺 More than 112 million Russians will vote this weekend for their next president, which is expected to be Vladimir #Putin once again. If he serves a fifth term, this will make him the longest serving #Kremlin chief since Josef Stalin. 

Two year after the #Ukraine war started and amid growing tensions with the West, what's at stake ? Swipe to know more 👆

🇺🇸 Joe #Biden and Donald #Trump secured their parties' nominations Tuesday, just one week after the #SuperTuesday primaries.

🤔 Despite their wins, both contenders face scepticism from voters.

🇷🇺 Ukrainian #drones caused a fire at a Russian oil refinery Wednesday, injuring at least two people and sparking a fire. 

🗳️ President Vladimir #Putin threatened to use nuclear weapons, while saying the attacks were an attempt to interfere with the incoming presidential elections.

#Israel 🇮🇱 is on the verge of cutting budget for its #Arab population, to plug a financial hole caused by the war in #Gaza. More than 55% of Israel’s Bedouins live in poverty, and violent crime is on the rise in many Arab-majority cities.

Andrew Hilliar, Claire Duhamel and Maral Quttieneh sent us this #FOCUS report ⤵️
